name: Ramen
description: Japanese noodle soup with rich broth, wheat noodles, and toppings like chashu pork, ajitsuke egg, nori seaweed, and green onions.

name: Sushi
description: Vinegared rice topped with fresh fish, seafood, or vegetables featuring precise knife work and minimal seasoning.

name: Tempura
description: Light, crispy battered and fried seafood and vegetables known for its delicate, almost transparent batter.

name: Monjayaki
description: Signature savory pancake made with a runny batter, cabbage, and various toppings, cooked on a hot plate.

name: Chanko Nabe
description: Hearty hot pot traditionally eaten by sumo wrestlers, with chicken, vegetables, and tofu in a rich broth.

name: Takoyaki
description: Signature street food - round balls of wheat flour batter filled with diced octopus, topped with takoyaki sauce and bonito flakes.

name: Okonomiyaki
description: Savory pancake with cabbage, meat or seafood, topped with okonomiyaki sauce, mayo, and bonito flakes.

name: Kushikatsu
description: Deep-fried skewered meat and vegetables in panko breadcrumbs. Traditional rule: no double-dipping in the communal sauce!

name: Ikayaki
description: Street food of grilled squid pressed between two metal plates, often served with special sauce.

name: Butaman
description: Steamed pork buns, larger and juicier than typical Chinese versions. A convenience store staple.

name: Butter Chicken
description: Creamy tomato-based curry with tender chicken pieces, invented in the 1950s. Rich with butter, cream, and aromatic spices.

name: Chole Bhature
description: Popular North Indian dish of spicy chickpea curry served with deep-fried bread. A breakfast staple.

name: Kebabs
description: Famous grilled meat skewers, especially seekh kebabs and galouti kebabs from Mughlai cuisine.

name: Parathas
description: Flaky, buttery flatbreads stuffed with potatoes, cauliflower, or other fillings. Best from traditional street vendors.

name: Chaat
description: Famous street snacks like bhel puri, aloo tikki, and golgappa with tangy tamarind and mint chutneys.

name: Vada Pav
description: Beloved street food - spiced potato fritter served in a bread roll with chutneys. Often called the Indian burger.

name: Pav Bhaji
description: Street food of spiced mashed vegetables served with buttered bread rolls. Originated as fast food for mill workers.

name: Bombay Duck Curry
description: Traditional Maharashtrian curry made with bombay duck fish (actually a lizardfish), cooked in coconut and spices.

name: Bhel Puri
description: Signature chaat made with puffed rice, vegetables, tamarind, and mint chutneys. Best eaten at beachside stalls.

name: Misal Pav
description: Spicy curry made with sprouted lentils, topped with onions, tomatoes, and served with bread. Breakfast favorite.

name: Xiaolongbao
description: Soup dumplings with thin dough wrapping pork filling and hot broth. Eaten carefully to avoid spilling the soup.

name: Shengjianbao
description: Pan-fried pork buns with crispy bottom and soft top, filled with pork and gelatin that melts into soup. A breakfast favorite.

name: Red-Braised Pork Belly
description: Hong shao rou - pork belly braised in soy sauce, rice wine, and rock sugar until tender and glossy.

name: Scallion Oil Noodles
description: Simple noodles tossed with fragrant scallion oil, soy sauce, and sugar. Comfort food that showcases technique over ingredients.

name: White Cut Chicken
description: Poached whole chicken served cold, sliced and eaten with ginger-scallion sauce. A classic cold dish.

name: Peking Duck
description: Famous roasted duck with crispy skin, served with thin pancakes, scallions, cucumber, and hoisin sauce.

name: Jianbing
description: Street breakfast crepe with egg, crispy wonton crackers, scallions, cilantro, and sweet and savory sauces.

name: Zhajiangmian
description: Noodles with fermented soybean paste sauce, diced pork, and julienned vegetables. A beloved comfort food.

name: Beijing Lamb Hot Pot
description: Traditional hot pot with paper-thin sliced lamb cooked in clear broth, served with sesame sauce.

name: Donkey Burger
description: Traditional street food - slow-cooked donkey meat in a crispy fired bread pocket. Considered a local delicacy.

name: Dim Sum
description: Cantonese tradition of small plates served with tea. Includes dumplings, buns, rolls, and pastries from teahouse culture.

name: Wonton Noodle Soup
description: Cantonese soup with thin egg noodles and wontons filled with shrimp and pork in a clear, light broth.

name: Char Siu
description: Cantonese barbecued pork with a sweet and savory glaze, traditionally roasted on skewers over an open fire.

name: Steamed Spare Ribs with Black Bean
description: Classic Cantonese dim sum dish of pork ribs marinated in fermented black bean sauce and steamed until tender.

name: Mapo Tofu
description: Iconic Sichuan dish of silky tofu in spicy, numbing sauce with ground pork and Sichuan peppercorns.

name: Kung Pao Chicken
description: Classic Sichuan stir-fry with diced chicken, peanuts, vegetables, and dried chilies in a sweet and spicy sauce.

name: Dandan Noodles
description: Sichuan street food noodles in spicy sesame sauce with preserved vegetables, minced pork, and Sichuan peppercorns.

name: Hot Pot
description: Sichuan-style spicy hot pot with numbingly spicy broth, featuring raw ingredients cooked at the table.

name: Twice-Cooked Pork
description: Sichuan dish of pork belly first boiled then stir-fried with cabbage, peppers, and fermented bean paste.

name: Biang Biang Noodles
description: Signature hand-pulled belt noodles, wide and thick, served with spicy chili oil and vegetables.

name: Roujiamo
description: Chinese hamburger with slow-cooked spiced pork stuffed in a crispy flatbread.

name: Liangpi Cold Noodles
description: Cold noodles made from wheat or rice starch, served with cucumber, bean sprouts, and spicy sauce.

name: Yangrou Paomo
description: Traditional soup with mutton and hand-torn bread soaked in rich, flavorful broth.

name: Persimmon Cake
description: Sweet treat made from persimmon pulp and flour, pan-fried until golden and filled with sweet paste.

name: Pad Thai
description: Thailand's national dish - stir-fried rice noodles with eggs, tofu or shrimp, bean sprouts, and sweet-tangy tamarind sauce.

name: Tom Yum Goong
description: Iconic Thai hot and sour soup with shrimp, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, galangal, and chili peppers.

name: Green Curry
original: แกงเขียวหวาน
description: Spicy Thai curry with green chilies, coconut milk, Thai basil, and chicken or beef. The most popular curry variety.

name: Mango Sticky Rice
original: ข้าวเหนียวมะม่วง
description: Classic Thai dessert of sweet coconut sticky rice served with ripe mango slices. Perfect street food.

name: Som Tam
description: Spicy green papaya salad with tomatoes, green beans, peanuts, and lime dressing. Street food staple.

name: Kimchi Jjigae
description: Spicy Korean stew made with fermented kimchi, pork, tofu, and vegetables. A comfort food staple.

name: Bulgogi
description: Marinated grilled beef with soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, and garlic. The most famous Korean BBQ dish.

name: Bibimbap
description: Mixed rice bowl with vegetables, meat, egg, and gochujang sauce. Healthy comfort food.

name: Korean Fried Chicken
description: Double-fried crispy chicken with sweet and spicy glaze. Modern comfort food, perfect with beer.

name: Tteokbokki
description: Chewy rice cakes in spicy gochujang sauce. Popular street food, especially around universities.

name: Fish and Chips
description: Britain's national dish - battered and deep-fried white fish served with thick-cut chips, mushy peas, and malt vinegar.

name: Bangers and Mash
description: Traditional British comfort food of sausages with mashed potatoes and onion gravy. A pub classic.

name: Beef Wellington
description: Elegant dish of beef tenderloin coated with pâté and wrapped in puff pastry. Associated with upscale dining.

name: Full English Breakfast
description: Traditional breakfast with eggs, bacon, sausages, baked beans, grilled tomatoes, mushrooms, and toast.

name: Chicken Tikka Masala
description: Britain's most popular curry - roasted chicken in spiced tomato-cream sauce. Invented by Bangladeshi chefs.

name: Croissant
description: Buttery, flaky pastry that's the symbol of French breakfast culture. Best enjoyed fresh from a boulangerie with coffee.

name: Coq au Vin
description: Classic French dish of chicken braised in red wine with mushrooms, bacon, and pearl onions. A bistro favorite.

name: French Onion Soup
description: Classic bistro soup with caramelized onions, beef broth, and melted Gruyère cheese on top.

name: Escargot
description: Traditional French appetizer of snails cooked in garlic, parsley, and butter. A delicacy.

name: Crème Brûlée
description: Classic French dessert with rich custard base topped with caramelized sugar. Pastry perfection.

name: Carbonara
description: Roman pasta dish with eggs, Pecorino Romano cheese, guanciale, and black pepper. No cream in the authentic version.

name: Cacio e Pepe
description: Simple Roman pasta with just Pecorino Romano cheese, black pepper, and pasta water. Deceptively difficult to perfect.

name: Saltimbocca
description: Roman veal dish with prosciutto and sage, cooked in white wine. Literally means 'jumps in the mouth'.

name: Supplì
description: Roman street food - fried rice balls stuffed with mozzarella. The cheese stretches like telephone wires when bitten.

name: Gelato
description: Italian ice cream served at warmer temperature than regular ice cream, with intense flavors and creamy texture.

name: Pizza Margherita
description: The original Neapolitan pizza with tomato sauce, mozzarella di bufala, fresh basil, and olive oil. Represents the Italian flag colors.

name: Paella
description: Traditional Spanish rice dish with saffron, vegetables, and either seafood, chicken, or rabbit depending on the style.

name: New York Pizza
description: Large, thin-crust pizza sold by the slice. Foldable slices with simple toppings like cheese or pepperoni are classics.

name: Bagel with Lox
description: Breakfast staple - everything bagel with cream cheese, smoked salmon, capers, red onion, and sometimes tomato.

name: Pastrami on Rye
description: Classic deli sandwich with thick-cut pastrami, mustard, and pickles on rye bread. Deli specialty.

name: Cheesecake
description: Dense, creamy New York-style cheesecake with graham cracker crust. Often served plain or with berry topping.

name: Hot Dog
description: Street cart classic - grilled or steamed frankfurter with mustard, ketchup, onions, and sauerkraut.

name: Tacos al Pastor
description: Iconic tacos with marinated pork cooked on a vertical spit, served with pineapple, onion, and cilantro.

name: Chilaquiles
description: Traditional Mexican breakfast of fried tortilla chips simmered in salsa, topped with cheese, crema, and onions.

name: Pozole
description: Traditional Mexican soup with hominy corn, pork or chicken, and red chili broth. Often served with radishes and oregano.

name: Tamales
description: Corn dough stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables, wrapped in corn husks and steamed. Street food classic.

name: Churros
description: Fried dough pastry dusted with cinnamon sugar, often filled with dulce de leche. Popular dessert.

name: Tapas
description: Small plates of appetizers or snacks. Tapas culture includes patatas bravas, jamón ibérico, and pan con tomate.

name: Crema Catalana
description: Traditional Catalan dessert similar to crème brûlée, flavored with lemon zest and cinnamon.

name: Pan con Tomate
description: Simple Catalan dish of bread rubbed with tomato, garlic, olive oil, and salt. A breakfast staple.

name: Calcots
description: Grilled spring onions served with romesco sauce, traditionally eaten during winter months.

name: Cocido Madrileño
description: Traditional chickpea stew with vegetables, chorizo, and various meats, served in multiple courses.

name: Bocadillo de Calamares
description: Famous fried squid sandwich, typically served in a crusty bread roll with lemon.

name: Torrijas
description: Spanish version of French toast, soaked in milk and wine, then fried and dusted with cinnamon. Easter tradition.

name: Huevos Rotos
description: Broken eggs over fried potatoes, often with jamón ibérico. Simple but beloved comfort food.

name: Patatas Bravas
description: Fried potato cubes served with spicy tomato sauce and aioli. Classic tapas dish.

name: Risotto alla Milanese
description: Creamy Milanese rice dish flavored with saffron, butter, and Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

name: Cotoletta alla Milanese
description: Breaded veal cutlet fried in butter, a signature dish dating back to the 12th century.

name: Panettone
description: Sweet bread loaf with candied fruits and raisins, traditionally eaten at Christmas.

name: Osso Buco
description: Braised veal shanks cooked with vegetables, white wine, and broth. Classic comfort food.

name: Aperitivo
description: Pre-dinner drink culture with cocktails like Negroni or Aperol Spritz served with small bites.

name: Currywurst
description: Iconic street food - sliced sausage served with curry-spiced ketchup and fries. Post-war invention.

name: Döner Kebab
description: Turkish-German fusion - rotisserie meat in pita bread with vegetables and sauce. The best döner outside Turkey.

name: Eisbein
description: Traditional pork knuckle served with sauerkraut and mashed peas. Hearty German comfort food.

name: Berliner Pfannkuchen
description: Jelly donuts, especially popular during New Year's celebrations. Called 'Berliners' elsewhere in Germany.

name: Sauerbraten
description: German pot roast marinated in vinegar and spices, served with red cabbage and dumplings.

name: Nihari
description: Slow-cooked stew with beef or mutton, traditionally eaten for breakfast. Rich with spices and bone marrow.

name: Biryani
description: Fragrant basmati rice with spiced meat and potatoes. Different from other regional biryanis.

name: Haleem
description: Thick stew of lentils, meat, and spices, slow-cooked to creamy consistency. Popular during Ramadan.

name: Adobo
description: Philippines' national dish - meat braised in vinegar, soy sauce, garlic, and bay leaves. Every Filipino family has their version.

name: Lechon
description: Whole roasted pig, crispy skin and tender meat. The centerpiece of Filipino celebrations and the most iconic dish.

name: Halo-Halo
description: Iconic Filipino dessert with shaved ice, evaporated milk, and various toppings like beans, fruit, and ice cream.

name: Rendang
description: Spicy slow-cooked beef in coconut milk and spices. Originally from Sumatra but beloved throughout the region.

name: Nasi Gudeg
description: Javanese dish of young jackfruit stewed in coconut milk, palm sugar, and spices, served with rice.

name: Gado-Gado
description: Indonesian salad with mixed vegetables, tofu, tempeh, and boiled eggs, served with peanut sauce dressing.

name: Pho
description: Vietnam's famous noodle soup with beef or chicken, herbs, and rice noodles. Southern style is sweeter than northern.

name: Banh Mi
description: Vietnamese sandwich on French baguette with pâté, meat, pickled vegetables, and herbs. French-Vietnamese fusion.

name: Bun Bo Hue
description: Spicy beef noodle soup from central Vietnam. Thicker noodles and lemongrass broth.

name: Hainanese Chicken Rice
description: Singapore's national dish - poached chicken with fragrant rice cooked in chicken stock, served with chili and ginger sauce.

name: Laksa
description: Spicy noodle soup with coconut milk, prawns, and rice noodles. Singapore's version is rich and creamy.

name: Chili Crab
description: Singapore's signature seafood dish - mud crabs in sweet and savory tomato-chili sauce. Eaten with mantou bread.

name: Milk Tea
description: Hong Kong-style milk tea with black tea and evaporated milk, strained through silk stockings for smoothness.

name: Meat Pie
description: Australian hand-held pie filled with minced meat and gravy. A pub and sporting event staple.

name: Barramundi
description: Australian native fish, grilled or pan-fried. Popular in restaurants for its mild flavor and flaky texture.

name: Lamington
description: Australian sponge cake squares coated in chocolate and coconut. Named after Lord Lamington, Queensland governor.

name: Kebab
description: Turkish grilled meat, the original kebab. Offers countless varieties from döner to şiş kebab.

name: Turkish Delight
description: Sweet confection with starch and sugar, often flavored with rosewater. The most famous sweet treat.

name: Baklava
description: Layered pastry with nuts and honey syrup. Features pistachios and delicate phyllo layers.

name: Borscht
description: Beet soup that's a staple of Russian cuisine. Often includes beef and served with sour cream.

name: Beef Stroganoff
description: Tender beef in rich sour cream sauce, served over noodles. Classic Russian comfort food.

name: Blini
description: Thin Russian pancakes served with various toppings like caviar, sour cream, or jam. Breakfast staple.

name: Moussaka
description: Layered casserole with eggplant, meat, and béchamel sauce. Greece's most famous dish.

name: Souvlaki
description: Grilled meat skewers served with pita, tzatziki, and vegetables. Street food at its finest.

name: Greek Salad
description: Village salad with tomatoes, cucumbers, olives, and feta cheese. Simple but perfect with olive oil.

name: Stroopwafel
description: Thin waffle cookies with caramel syrup filling. Best eaten warm over a cup of coffee in cafes.

name: Dutch Cheese
description: World-famous Gouda and Edam cheeses. Cheese markets showcase centuries of Dutch cheese-making.

name: Herring
description: Raw herring eaten whole with onions and pickles. Traditional street food, eaten by holding the tail.

name: Wiener Schnitzel
description: Breaded veal cutlet, Vienna's signature dish. Traditionally served with lemon and potato salad.

name: Sachertorte
description: Chocolate cake with apricot jam and chocolate glaze. Created in Vienna and still made at the original Hotel Sacher.

name: Apple Strudel
description: Paper-thin pastry filled with spiced apples. Vienna's most beloved dessert, served with vanilla sauce.

name: Goulash
description: Hearty beef stew with paprika, traditionally served with bread dumplings. The ultimate comfort food.

name: Svíčková
description: Czech beef sirloin in cream sauce with bread dumplings and cranberries. The national dish.

name: Czech Beer
description: World's best beer, invented in Prague. Czech Republic has the highest beer consumption per capita globally.

name: Meatballs
description: Swedish meatballs with cream sauce, lingonberry, and potatoes. The most exported culinary tradition.

name: Gravlax
description: Cured salmon with dill, sugar, and salt. Traditional Swedish preparation, perfect with mustard sauce.

name: Cinnamon Bun
description: Swedish cinnamon bun, less sweet than American versions. There's a national cinnamon bun day (October 4).

name: Fish Tacos
description: Battered fish in corn tortillas with cabbage slaw and crema. Mexican-influenced coastal cuisine at its best.

name: Korean BBQ
description: Grilled meat with banchan side dishes. Koreatown has the best Korean BBQ outside of Korea.

name: French Dip Sandwich
description: Roast beef sandwich served with au jus for dipping. Invented in LA in the early 1900s.

name: Cobb Salad
description: Chopped salad with bacon, chicken, blue cheese, and avocado. Created at Hollywood's Brown Derby restaurant in 1937.

name: Deep Dish Pizza
description: Chicago's signature thick-crust pizza with cheese on bottom and sauce on top. More like a pie than pizza.

name: Italian Beef
description: Thinly sliced beef in spicy jus on Italian bread. Chicago's messy but beloved sandwich, often dipped.

name: Chicago Hot Dog
description: All-beef hot dog with yellow mustard, onions, relish, tomato, pickle, sport peppers, and celery salt. Never ketchup!

name: Poutine
description: French fries with cheese curds and gravy. Quebec's invention, but countless variations have been perfected.

name: Peameal Bacon Sandwich
description: Back bacon rolled in cornmeal, served on a bun. Signature breakfast sandwich at St. Lawrence Market.

name: Butter Tart
description: Sweet pastry tart with butter, sugar, and egg filling. Quintessentially Canadian dessert.

name: Sourdough Bread
description: Tangy bread made with wild yeast starter. Gold Rush-era sourdough culture is still alive.

name: Dungeness Crab
description: Sweet Pacific crab, best at Fisherman's Wharf. Signature seafood, in season November-June.

name: Mission Burrito
description: Oversized burrito with rice, beans, meat, and salsa. Invented in SF's Mission District, copied worldwide.

name: Bagel
description: Montreal-style bagels are smaller, denser, and sweeter than New York bagels. Wood-fired and hand-rolled.

name: Smoked Meat
description: Cured beef brisket, similar to pastrami but with different spices. Jewish deli tradition since 1884.

name: Tourtière
description: Traditional French-Canadian meat pie, especially popular at Christmas. Quebec's most iconic dish.

name: Feijoada
description: Brazil's national dish - black bean stew with pork, beef, and sausage. The most elaborate versions are served here.

name: Pastel
description: Crispy fried pastry with various fillings. Japanese-Brazilian fusion created unique versions.

name: Brigadeiro
description: Chocolate truffle rolled in sprinkles. Brazil's most beloved sweet, essential at every celebration.

name: Açaí Bowl
description: Frozen açaí berries blended into smoothie bowls with granola and fruit. Beach culture essential.

name: Churrasco
description: Brazilian barbecue with various cuts of meat grilled on skewers. Churrasquerias are legendary.

name: Caipirinha
description: Brazil's national cocktail with cachaça, lime, and sugar. Perfect for beach bars and carnival.

name: Asado
description: Argentine barbecue featuring various cuts of beef grilled over wood fire. This art form was perfected here.

name: Empanadas
description: Baked pastries with meat, cheese, or vegetable fillings. Each Argentine province has its style.

name: Dulce de Leche
description: Caramelized milk spread, Argentina's national obsession. Consumed more per capita than anywhere.

name: Ceviche
description: Fresh fish cured in citrus acids with onions and chilies. Lima is the ceviche capital of the world.

name: Lomo Saltado
description: Stir-fried beef with vegetables and fries, served over rice. Peru's Chinese-influenced fusion dish.

name: Pisco Sour
description: Cocktail with pisco brandy, lime juice, syrup, and egg white. Peru's national drink.

name: Arepas
description: Corn cakes filled with cheese, meat, or vegetables. This version is thicker than Venezuelan arepas.

name: Bandeja Paisa
description: Hearty platter with beans, rice, meat, plantain, and egg. Colombia's most famous regional dish.

name: Aguardiente
description: Anise-flavored spirit, Colombia's national liquor. Essential for nightlife and celebrations.

name: Empanadas de Pino
description: Chilean empanadas with beef, onions, raisins, and olives. This version is the national standard.

name: Pastel de Choclo
description: Corn casserole with meat, onions, and hard-boiled eggs. Traditional Chilean comfort food.

name: Completo
description: Chilean hot dog loaded with avocado, tomatoes, and mayo. Countless creative variations exist.

name: Jollof Rice
description: Spiced rice dish with tomatoes, onions, and peppers. The most celebrated version in West Africa.

name: Suya
description: Spiced grilled meat skewers, Nigeria's favorite street food. The most creative suya variations.

name: Pounded Yam
description: Smooth starchy side dish served with soups and stews. Essential comfort food.

name: Ful Medames
description: Stewed fava beans with olive oil, garlic, and lemon. Egypt's national dish, eaten daily.

name: Koshari
description: Mixed rice, lentils, pasta with spicy tomato sauce. The most popular street food dish.

name: Mahshi
description: Stuffed vegetables with rice, herbs, and spices. Traditional family meal, especially grape leaves.

name: Bobotie
description: Spiced meatloaf with egg topping, influenced by Cape Malay cuisine. South Africa's national dish.

name: Biltong
description: Dried cured meat, similar to jerky but with different spices. Traditional preservation method.

name: Koeksisters
description: Twisted fried dough soaked in syrup. Beloved sweet treat, different from Afrikaner version.

name: Tagine
description: Slow-cooked stew in conical clay pot with meat, vegetables, and preserved lemons. Morocco's signature cooking method.

name: Couscous
description: Steamed semolina grains served with stew. Friday tradition in homes, UNESCO cultural heritage.

name: Pastilla
description: Sweet and savory pie with pigeon or chicken, almonds, and cinnamon in phyllo pastry. Moroccan feast centerpiece.

name: Nyama Choma
description: Grilled meat, Kenya's national dish. Carnivore restaurants made this internationally famous.

name: Ugali
description: Cornmeal staple food eaten with hands alongside stews and vegetables. Essential comfort food.

name: Mandazi
description: Sweet fried bread, East Africa's donut. Perfect with strong chai tea for breakfast.

name: Machboos
description: Spiced rice with meat or fish, Gulf region's signature dish. The most popular traditional meal.

name: Shawarma
description: Roasted meat in pita bread with vegetables and sauce. This Levantine street food has been perfected here.

name: Knafeh
description: Sweet cheese pastry soaked in syrup. Dessert scene features the best knafeh outside the Levant.

name: Hummus
description: Chickpea puree with tahini, olive oil, and spices. Hummus culture is unmatched globally.

name: Falafel
description: Fried chickpea balls in pita with vegetables and tahini. Street food staple and national dish.

name: Shakshuka
description: Eggs poached in spiced tomato sauce. Breakfast favorite, served with fresh bread.

name: Kabsa
description: Spiced rice with meat, vegetables, and aromatic spices. Saudi Arabia's national dish.

name: Mutabbaq
description: Stuffed pancake with meat, vegetables, or sweet fillings. Popular street food, especially during Ramadan.

name: Ma'amoul
description: Date-filled semolina cookies, especially popular during Eid. Traditional sweet served to guests.
